contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Weapon |name=Nudelman-Suranov NS-23 |image=[[Image:Cropped NS-23.jpg|300px]] |caption=A Nudelman-Suranov NS-23 cannon on display at the National Museum of the US Air Force |origin={{Flag|USSR}} |type=[[Autocannon]] <!-- Type selection --> |is_ranged=yes |is_artillery=yes <!-- Service history --> |service= |used_by={{Flag|USSR}} |wars=[[Cold War]] <!-- Production history --> |designer= |design_date= |manufacturer= |production_date=1944â€”1953 |number=28479 |variants= <!-- General specifications --> |weight= {{Convert|37|kg|lb}} |length= {{Convert|198.5|cm|ft}} |part_length={{Convert|145|cm|ft}} |width= |height= |crew= <!-- Ranged weapon specifications --> |cartridge=[[23x115mm]] |cartridge_weight={{Convert|175|g|oz|abbr=on}} |caliber={{Convert|23|mm|in}} |action= [[Recoil operation#Short recoil operation|short recoil]] |rate=550 rpm |velocity={{Convert|690|m/s|ft/s}} |range= |max_range= |feed=belt |sights= <!-- Artillery specifications --> |breech= |recoil= |carriage= |elevation= |traverse= }} The '''NS-23''' was a {{Convert|23|mm|abbr=on}} aircraft [[autocannon|cannon]] designed by [[A. E. Nudelman]], [[A. Suranov]], [[G. Zhirnykh]], [[V. Nemenov]], [[S. Lunin]], and [[M. Bundin]] during [[World War II]] as a replacement for the [[Volkov-Yartsev VYa-23]] cannon. It entered service in 1944. The NS-23 round was derived from the [[14.5x114mm]] anti-tank round by necking it out to 23 mm. A synchronized version, designated '''NS-23S''' (''S'' for '''''s'''ynchronized''), was used for fixed installations firing through the [[Propeller (aircraft)|propeller]] disc. Applications of the NS-23 included the [[Antonov An-2]], [[Ilyushin Il-10]], [[Ilyushin Il-22]], [[Lavochkin La-7]], [[Lavochkin La-15]], [[MiG-9]], [[Yakovlev Yak-7]], [[Yakovlev Yak-9|Yak-9U]], [[Yakovlev Yak-15|Yak-15]], [[Yakovlev Yak-17|Yak-17]], and [[Yakovlev Yak-23|Yak-23]]. Some early [[MiG-15]]s also were equipped the NS-23. The NS-23 was replaced in service by the [[Nudelman-Rikhter NR-23]] around 1949. ==External links== * [http://www.airpages.ru/eng/ru/ns23.shtml The NS-23 on airpages.ru] ==References== *{{Cite book | last = Koll | first = Christian | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = Soviet Cannon - A Comprehensive Study of Soviet Arms and Ammunition in Calibres 12.7mm to 57mm | publisher = Koll | date = 2009 | location = Austria | url = http://www.russianammo.org | doi = | id = ISBN 978-3-200-01445-9 | page = 131 }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nudelman-Suranov Ns-23}} [[Category:Aircraft guns]] [[Category:Automatic cannons]] [[Category:Aircraft guns of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:23 mm artillery]]
